title: MacBooks in 2023: the best launches so far and what’s coming next
description: As we hit the midpoint of 2023, let's take a look at how Apple's laptop line is faring – and what we hope to see next.

title: Today's tech news live: Meta's Twitter killer Threads lands early and more
description: Feeling a bit behind on today's tech news? We've rounded up all the latest stories in this liveblog, including the latest on Meta's Threads.

title: Samsung Unpacked 2023: foldable phones and everything we expect to see
description: Samsung's Galaxy S23 launch event is now over – here's everything that was announced.

title: ChatGPT pulls plug on Bing integration after people used it to bypass paywalls
description: In an apparent effort to avoid legal trouble, OpenAI pauses ChatGPT's Browse with Bing

title: Twitter tries to fix its latest mistake as Meta readies its Threads launch
description: As Meta's Threads app is preparing for launch, Twitter quietly reversed its policy change requiring an account to view tweets.

title: Check out leaked renders of the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5, Flip 5, and Tab S9 before Samsung pulls them down
description: Renders of Samsung’s new foldable phones make a surprise early appearance online, along with the next flagship tablet.

title: The Fairphone 4 comes to the US – but it's not running the Android you know
description: Sustainable smartphone brand Fairphone makes a US debut with a secure twist.

title: Will every iPhone 15 model have a Dynamic Island? Here's what we know
description: Will all four iPhone 15 models have a Dynamic Island instead of a notch? Here's what the leaks and rumors say.

title: A 4G ‘smartphone’ for the price of a McDonald’s Big Mac meal? An Indian company just launched it
description: One of India’s biggest mobile companies is selling a $12 handset that can play movies.

title: ChromeOS gets a softer look — and it's coming to Chromebooks soon
description: Google ChromeOS will soon be getting the rounded web page corners feature as part of the Material You update.

title: This new Android malware is draining bank accounts across the world - here's what you need to know
description: Major banks including Santander, BBVA, CaixaBank, Deutsche Bank, Crédit Agricole, and ING hit by malware.

title: The Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 and 6 Classic are coming this month, according to a Google listing
description: Yet more confirmation we're getting Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 and 6 Classic at Unpacked, but no Pro.

title: Gaming MacBooks are no longer a joke thanks to major free update
description: Watch out, gaming laptops – MacBooks just got a serious performance boost.

title: This new smartphone has more RAM and storage than a MacBook Air
description: The Nubia Red Magic 8S Pro and Pro Plus gaming phones have just made their debut in China, offering up to a whopping 1TB of RAM and 24GB of storage.

title: RAM prices falls are slowing, and that could be a good thing for all of us
description: Manufacturers are cutting production of DDR4, meaning higher-capacity DDR5 kits could become more readily available from next year.

title: 8BitDo partners with SNK to recreate a seriously cool retro controller
description: 8BitDo has teamed up with SNK for a recreation of the Neo Geo CD controller with some modern touches.

title: Microsoft could soon be facing a major EU antitrust investigation
description: One case is settled, but another inches closer to a full-blown investigation that could be worth 10% of Microsoft’s turnover.

title: Twitter explains why it sabotaged your feed without notice – but no end is in sight
description: Twitter has finally explained why it sabotaged your feed with rate limits, but restrictions are still sticking around for now.

title: Many companies aren't prepared for darknet data leaks
description: Many are showing indifference and lacking points of contact, while some deny being breached in the first place.

title: Use Google Chrome? Your browser is about to get some key upgrades
description: Google plans to roll out sweeping changes for all users of its Chrome browser as part of its Privacy Sandbox scheme.

title: If you're one of the millions who installed these malicious Google Chrome extensions, delete them now
description: These Chrome extensions have been removed from the Web Store, but you'll still need to remove them from your browser.

title: Apple TV Plus cancels another show, but unlike Disney it won't stop you watching it
description: Monster Factory was loved by its viewers, but it seems there just weren't enough of them.

title: Netflix is doubling down on anime shows and Pokémon, with bonus zombies
description: Netflix is investing heavily in the Japanese market and it looks like money well spent.

title: Disney Plus’ recent movie Crater just earned an embarrassing record that no one wants
description: The Disney Plus original movie, which only launched in May, has already been removed from the streaming platform.

title: Firefox finally pulls support for Windows 7, 8, so update now
description: Mozilla has issued a final warning for Windows 7/8 and macOS 10.12/10.13/10.14 users ahead of Firefox 116 release.

title: Apple’s Vision Pro might be impossible to buy – and not just because of its price
description: Apple might produce limited numbers of its new Vision Pro VR headset in 2024, which could make it a challenge to buy one.

title: Over a third of governments don't think they can deal with ransomware attacks
description: Report on the disaster recovery strategies adopted by governments has some worrying conclusions.

title: Entire iPhone 15 lineup tipped for serious battery life upgrades
description: New rumors suggest the entire iPhone 15 line could be set for larger batteries than their respective predecessors.

title: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5’s gapless new design has been shown off in photos
description: Samsung's gappy foldable design might finally be fixed with the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5.

title: Vodafone is going quantum to supercharge your next business phone
description: A new test aims to see how VPNs could perform in the future running on quantum computers.

title: Hidden change to Windows 11 Start menu uncovered in testing – and we like it
description: It looks like Microsoft wants to make it clear what Windows 11’s default apps are in the Start menu.

title: Many bosses still want humans involved in tech, not just AI
description: Concerns about ethics and cybersecurity are holding some companies back from adopting AI.

title: Microsoft expects the PS5 Slim to launch sometime this year
description: In its ongoing legal battle with the FTC, Microsoft revealed it expects Sony's PS5 Slim console to launch this year.

title: The legal battle between Apple and Epic heats up again as Supreme Court looms
description: Apple has made its intentions clear to take Epic Games to Supreme Court in the attempt to turnover the 2021 decision.

title: It's official: "Starfield has the best rocks" some fans have ever seen
description: Fans are obsessing over Starfield's realistic rocks, with many agreeing they're the best they've ever seen.
